```java
public void onItemClick(AdapterView<?> parent, View view, int position, long id) {
    File selected = new File(fileList.get(position));
    if(selected.isDirectory()) {
        ListDir(selected);
    } else {
        Toast.makeText(MainActivity.this, selected.toString() + "selected", Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show();
        dismissDialog(CUSTOM_DIALOG_ID);

        // Read the content of the file
        StringBuilder text = new StringBuilder();
        try {
            BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(selected));
            String line;

            while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
                text.append(line);
                text.append('\n');
            }
            br.close();
        }
        catch (IOException e) {
            // You'll need to add proper error handling here
        }

        // Find the TextView and set the text
        TextView result = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.result);
        result.setText(text.toString());
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, when a file is selected from the ListView, it checks if the selected item is a directory or a file. If it's a file, it reads the content of the file using BufferedReader.readLine() method. This method reads a line of text from the file. A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a linefeed. The read lines are appended to a StringBuilder object with a newline character for each line. After reading all lines from the file, the content is set to the TextView with id "result".
